vehicles.description: A large, red truck partially visible on the right side, occupying the adjacent lane, with a loaded cargo area covered by a tarpaulin.
vehicles.explanation: Its presence in the adjacent lane is crucial for maintaining a safe lateral distance and for being prepared if the truck makes unexpected movements.

traffic lights.description: Traffic lights overhead displaying red for the lanes going straight and green for the lane that peels off to the right.
traffic lights.explanation: The red signal indicates that the ego car must stop if it intends to continue straight ahead, while the green signal indicates that vehicles may proceed in the lane that turns right.

traffic cones.description: Orange and white traffic cones are placed in a line, indicating a separation between the lanes and a potential merging of lanes or construction ahead.
traffic cones.explanation: The traffic cones suggest lane restrictions and require the driver to follow the indicated path, staying within the lane boundaries.

barriers.description: Green barriers run along the left side of the road, separating the road from the other side of the highway or oncoming traffic.
barriers.explanation: Barriers indicate that crossing into oncoming lanes is not possible and help in channeling the traffic into the correct flows.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, we observe a large, red truck partially visible on the right sideâ€”occupying the adjacent lane with its cargo area covered by a tarpaulin. Its presence is critical for maintaining a safe lateral distance from our vehicle and to be alert to any unexpected movements the truck might make.

Above, there are traffic lights displaying red for the lanes moving straight and green for the turning lane to the right. This indicates that while our vehicle must come to a stop if continuing straight ahead, it has the right of way to proceed if choosing to turn right.

Additionally, a series of orange and white traffic cones are aligned between lanes, signaling lane separation and indicating that there may be a merging of lanes or construction work upcoming. These cones are important in guiding the vehicle to keep within the lane limits and to be aware of potential alterations in the usual traffic pattern.

On the left side of the road, there are green barriers, creating a divide between the opposite sides of the highway or the oncoming traffic lanes. These barriers serve the purpose of preventing any possibility of the vehicle crossing into the oncoming traffic and ensure the direction of the traffic flows correctly.

These are all the notable road users and elements affecting the driving behavior and decision-making of the autonomous vehicle in the current scenario.

1.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, typically used in road work zones or around hazards that need temporary demarcation. It is predominantly orange with white horizontal striping, enhancing its visibility. The presence of this cone indicates that there may be either ongoing road work or an obstruction ahead on the road. It influences the future driving behavior of the ego car by signaling the driver to slow down, remain cautious, and possibly prepare for lane changes or detours to navigate safely around the hazard.

2.description and explanation: The object is a traffic cone typically used in road management to redirect traffic in a safe manner around construction sites or accidents or indicate areas under repair. It is bright orange with a reflective white band for high visibility. In the driving scenario, this traffic cone indicates that part of the lane or road ahead may be closed or has hazards, guiding the ego car to stay clear of the indicated area and potentially merge into an open lane for safe passage.

driving_suggestion: Maintain current lane while keeping a safe distance from the truck on the right. Prepare to stop due to the red traffic light unless intending to turn right, in which case, observe signage and road markings to proceed safely into the turning lane.
